arm_group.description: When patients encountered hepatotoxicity during the anti-TB treatment, genotyping and pk study of INH would be performed and dose adjustment accordingly.

brief_summary.textblock:
To improve the treatment outcome in patients with tuberculosis and integrate the
      pharmacogenetics into clinical practice, the information of NAT2 genotyping was used in
      re-challenge protocol for isoniazid (INH) titration in patients with anti-tuberculosis
      medication-induced hepatitis.

clinical_study.brief_title: NAT2 Genotyping in Re-challenge Protocol of INH Titration in Patients With Anti-TB Medications-induced Hepatitis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. >= 18 years.

          2. Take INH for at least a week.

          3. abnormal liver function (ALT (alanine, transaminase) increased by more than three
             times the upper limit of normal, or ALT higher than twice the upper limit of normal
             and total bilirubin higher than 2.0 mg / dL

        Exclusion Criteria:

        1.Taking INH before liver function abnormalities. 2.

intervention.description: dose adjustment according to the pharmacogenomic results

clinical_study.official_title: The Application of the N-acetyltransferase 2 (NAT2) Genotyping in Re-challenge Protocol of Isoniazid (INH) Titration in Patients With Anti-TB Medications-induced Hepatitis

primary_outcome.description: In this study, we would like to test the hypothesis of NAT2 genotyping helping in isoniazid rechallenge after patients experienced adverse effects of anti-TB treatment. Therefore, to observe the patients can re-use isoniazid successfully is an important outcome measure in this study.
primary_outcome.measure: successful re-use of isoniazid for TB treatment
